name: Please Stand By
description:
Over the past three years, Dingus has been wreaking havoc, chaos, and destruction throughout the upper Midwest with their collage of fun punk carols, catchy hooks and dynamic live shows. Jonathan Walters, Sam Beere-Hasman, and Parker Thompson are now dropping their second album, Please Stand By, their first in over three years.
Dingus combines the jazz influenced vocal class of Ben Folds Five, pop sensibility of Blink 182 and the straight up kick ass driving hardcore punk of Lagwagon. Jonathan Walters’ effortless tenor intones and Sam Beere’s sweet croons combine for enticing and infectious harmonies that one cannot resist but sing along. 
Please Stand By holds ten solid tracks of mesmerizing melodic pop punk featuring romantic laments, hierarchical protests, and songs regarding post high school life. The album contains bass and guitar licks so lush and carefully placed, it is difficult to abandon these three Grand Forks, N.D. natives among today’s punk market. Dingus’ musicianship is simply palpable and contains a true and innovative girth of modern pop punk, which can be appreciated by a wide alternative audience.

name: Fridge Full of Dreams
description: Forming in early 2004, Minneapolis’ Chicken Poodle Soup is a high-energy ska band which has been a favorite local act for the past 3 years. The band has determation to keep ska influenced music alive and kicking by bringing their music to listeners on both the local and national level. In the first two years of Chicken Poodle Soup’s career, the band played shows all around Minnesota and recorded their debut EP. The Legend of Scottie Guild was released in early November of 2005 and the band began to bring their energetic and fun shows to other Midwest states. The band recently recorded a new EP due out in April 2007 entitled Fridge Full of Dreams. Engineered, mixed, and mastered by Brian Johnson (Elvis Costello, Lenny Kravitz, Christina Aguilera) in Winterland Studios of Minneapolis, CPS hopes to reemerge onto the local ska scene with a bang. Now incorporating an entire new sound from their previous EP, The Legend of Scottie Guild, CPS adds together diverse sounds of ska, reggae, pop punk, and funk. Combining energetic hooks, intricate vocal harmonies, and catchy horn lines, Fridge Full of Dreams is sure to be a new ska favorite.

name: Chicken Poodle Soup Amp T
description: Available in small, medium, and large
